title: Threat Host Sweep
description:
After our Wi-Fi victory, strange things are happening—computers are sending mysterious signals like they're possessed! We need to sweep the network like detectives searching a crime scene and uncover any hidden intruders lurking in the shadows.

Objective: Become a network ghostbuster! Use ARP scans and ping sweeps to map out all the devices on the subnet and spot the suspicious ones that don't belong.
dialogue: Mira: "Whoa, after we cleaned up that Wi-Fi mess, some computers are still acting super shady—sending weird traffic like they're calling home to aliens!"
Mira: "I bet there are rogue devices hiding on our network. Can you help me scan the subnet and flush out any unknown hosts? Let's turn this into a digital treasure hunt!"
Mira: "Time to play 'Find the Intruder'—you're the expert detective!"
hints: ARP scans are like knocking on every door in the neighborhood—see who answers!
Try nmap -sn for a quick ping sweep, or arp-scan to map MAC addresses like fingerprints.
Look for devices with unfamiliar MACs—they might be the villains in disguise!
